skill.name: ghe-design
skill.description: Reference material for Athena when writing requirements. NOT a template - Athena writes requirements freely based on the domain. This skill provides guidance patterns that may be useful, not constraints to follow.
skill.summary: Reference material for Athena when writing requirements. NOT a template - Athena writes requirements...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance patterns. No code execution, no file access, no network calls, and no external commands. The skill provides reference material for writing requirements documents.

content.user_title: Write clear requirements with domain-appropriate patterns
content.value_statement: Writing requirements documents can be inconsistent and ambiguous. This skill provides guidance patterns for different domains including mathematical specs, game mechanics, financial systems, distributed architectures, and security specifications.
actual_capabilities: Provides guidance patterns for domain-specific requirements documents
Includes templates for mathematical, game mechanics, financial, distributed systems, and security specs
Establishes clarity principles for requirements writing
Defines mandatory elements every requirements document must contain
Offers performance philosophy guidance to avoid premature optimization
limitations: Does not generate requirements automatically - requires user input and guidance
Does not validate existing requirements against any external standards
Does not integrate with external documentation systems or APIs
Does not execute code or perform any technical implementation

use_cases.title: Define feature specifications
use_cases.description: Create clear, unambiguous requirements that developers can implement without follow-up questions

use_cases.title: Document system designs
use_cases.description: Write architectural requirements with proper threat models, consistency models, and failure modes

use_cases.title: Capture domain knowledge
use_cases.description: Translate specialized domain knowledge into structured requirements documents

prompt_templates.title: Basic Feature Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Write requirements for [FEATURE] that does [FUNCTION]. Include what, why, and acceptance criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Game Mechanic Spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Write game mechanic requirements including state machine, physics parameters, and feel requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Security Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Write security requirements with threat model, trust boundaries, authentication flow, and security headers.

prompt_templates.title: Distributed System
prompt_templates.prompt: Write distributed system requirements including consistency model, CAP tradeoffs, failure modes, and event schemas.

output_examples.input: Write requirements for a user authentication system
output: Problem statement describing what is being built
User story explaining why it's needed
Threat model with likelihood, impact, and mitigation
External references to OWASP and best practices

best_practices: Use domain-appropriate language - mathematical notation for algorithms, state diagrams for interactive systems, legal language for compliance
Include verifiable acceptance criteria - every requirement should have a way to verify it was met
Link to external documentation instead of copying entire specifications or RFCs
anti_patterns: Using rigid templates for all requirements regardless of domain suitability
Writing ambiguous acceptance criteria like 'works correctly' instead of testable outcomes
Including premature performance optimizations before the feature is fully functional

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for requirements writing tasks.

faq.question: What domains are covered?
faq.answer: Mathematical specifications, game mechanics, financial/legal, distributed systems, security, UI/UX, data pipelines, and hardware interfaces.

faq.question: Does this skill generate code?
faq.answer: No, this is a documentation-only skill. It provides guidance patterns for writing requirements, not actual code generation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is purely prompt-based with no file access, network calls, or data collection capabilities.

faq.question: Can I skip the template structure?
faq.answer: Yes, templates are references, not constraints. Use what's relevant for your domain and ignore what's not applicable.

faq.question: How is this different from REQ-TEMPLATE.md?
faq.answer: REQ-TEMPLATE.md provides mandatory structure. This skill provides optional guidance patterns for different domains to supplement requirements writing.
